words.definition: Armor is metal worn by soldiers to protect the body.
words.example: The soldier wore armor to protect his body.

words.definition: To blaze means to burn brightly or powerfully.
words.example: The small fire soon blazed into a large dangerous one.

words.definition: To boom means to make a loud, deep sound.
words.example: The firecrackers made a loud boom when they exploded.

words.definition: A cliff is a high and often flat wall of rock.
words.example: The wolf stood at the cliff and howled.

words.definition: A flame is part of fire.
words.example: The torch had a bright flame.

words.definition: Independence is the state of being free from the control of others.
words.example: The country gained its independence after a long war.

words.definition: An invasion is an attack by a group from another country.
words.example: The invasion of the enemy was stopped by the army.

words.definition: A knight is a soldier of high rank and honor in the past.
words.example: The knight rode his horse into battle.

words.definition: Lightning is the bright light in the sky during a rainstorm.
words.example: The lightning lit up the dark sky.

words.definition: A rebel is a person who fights against the government.
words.example: The rebels tried to overthrow the king.

words.definition: To retreat is to run away from a battle or dangerous situation.
words.example: The army was forced to retreat after losing many men.

words.definition: A revolution is a sudden and complete change in a government.
words.example: The revolution led to the creation of a new government.

words.definition: A spear is a long stick with a sharp point used as a weapon.
words.example: The hunter used a spear to catch fish.

words.definition: If a slope is steep, it goes up or down very quickly.
words.example: The mountain was very steep and difficult to climb.

words.definition: The summit is the highest part of a mountain.
words.example: It took them two days to reach the summit.

words.definition: Thunder is the loud noise in the sky during a rainstorm.
words.example: The sound of thunder scared the child.

words.definition: Troops are soldiers that fight in an army.
words.example: The troops marched into the city.

words.definition: A warrior is a person who fights in a war.
words.example: The ancient warriors were very brave.

words.definition: To withdraw is to leave a place or situation.
words.example: The army withdrew from the city.

words.definition: To yield is to stop fighting and agree to what someone wants.
words.example: The army finally yielded to the enemy.
